title: How to Make a Cement Mixer

steps.title: You need a pipe wrench, a drill with 3/32" and 1/4" bits, a screwdriver, a hacksaw, and an adjustable wrench.
steps.content: You need a pipe wrench, a drill with 3/32" and 1/4" bits, a screwdriver, a hacksaw, and an adjustable wrench.

steps.title: Get brackets, corner supports, or angle-iron scrap that can be trimmed.
steps.content: Get brackets, corner supports, or angle-iron scrap that can be trimmed. If you can't find that, cut the blades from 18-gauge sheet metal. Bend the blades and drill 2 1/4" holes in each section. Dig identical holes in the tub and secure them with 1/4" bolts.

steps.title: Putting bondo on the vessel's interior seals its holes.
steps.content: Putting bondo on the vessel's interior seals its holes.

steps.title: Mount the smaller rollers by pushing a nail into the disks.
steps.content: Mount the smaller rollers by pushing a nail into the disks. Tee fit and fasten it with a nut. Then, attach the main wheels as well.

steps.title: Slip the axle shaft through its tubular housing to make sure the large hubs are secure.
steps.content: Slip the axle shaft through its tubular housing to make sure the large hubs are secure. Then, put on the wheels and washers. Mark and drill the cotter pin holes as close as possible to the disks, to prevent the shaft from having excessive end play and wobble.

steps.title: The mixing drum rotates on the shaft fastened to the central pipe cross.
steps.content: The mixing drum rotates on the shaft fastened to the central pipe cross. Grease the pipe to slip the conduit over that, and lubricate the assembly yet again.

steps.title: Thread on the pipe cap to hold the components in place.
steps.content: Thread on the pipe cap to hold the components in place.

steps.title: Handles and paint are totally optional.
steps.content: Handles and paint are totally optional. You can use a set of bicycle grips for the handles.
